Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The HiddenFieldDesigner class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> in a visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HiddenFieldDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> at design time. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HiddenFieldDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the HiddenFieldDesigner class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyHiddenField` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField>. The `MyHiddenField` is a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField>. The example also derives the `MyHiddenFieldDesigner` class from the HiddenFieldDesigner class and applies a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute for the `MyHiddenFieldDesigner` on the `MyHiddenField` control.
The `MyHiddenFieldDesigner` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HiddenFieldDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate a placeholder that includes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.Value%2A> property in the placeholder, along with the control class name and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property.

## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method generates the markup for a placeholder that includes the control class name and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HiddenFieldDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control at design time. The GetDesignTimeHtml override generates a placeholder that includes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.Value%2A> property in the placeholder, along with the control class name and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control. The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control.
